description: Smallest prime that divides k^2 + k + 2n + 1 for k = 0,1,2,....
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..10000
formula: a(n)=3 if n is equal to 0 or 1 mod 3.
example: To obtain a(3), note that x^2+x+7 takes the values 7,9,13,19,... for k=0,1,2,... and the smallest prime dividing these numbers is 3.
crossrefs: Cf. A060380, A060392-A060398. A060398 gives values of k.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 04 2001
